intro: Stylidium induratum, commonly known as the hard-stemmed triggerplant, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its succulent, erect stems and fleshy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, vividly colored flowers that are typically pink or red, arranged in dense clusters. It is a member of the family Haemodoraceae, known for its unique floral structures and adaptations to arid environments. Stylidium induratum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in regions with low rainfall.
